ProjectTitle: Development of an innovative CRISPR-based tool for industrial yeast strain improvement
InitialFeedbackHistory:
26/05/2023
Is there a reason why you are not using storage that is managed by KU Leuven ICTS? Check the storagewijzer: https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en

The information on Data Sharing seems inconsistent. You mention GenBank and European Nucleotide Archive. Then also Addgene for vectors. But there's no vectors listed in your datasets. Then you mention the cost of KU Leuven RDM. It is actually KU Leuven RDR (Research Data Repository).
Nothing is said about sharing algorithms and scripts; will you share this via GitLab?

Have a look at guidance to improve this: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/data-sharing
label: good with suggestions
